title: Bruce Springsteen & The E Street Band Title: The Turnpike Is
description:
Bruce Springsteen & The E Street Band

Title: The Turnpike Is Closed, Nobody Goes Home (or 'The Greatest Show Springsteen Never Played')

'Label': Earlmv
Format: 4 cdr
Sources: audience, soundboard, pre-fm, fm-broadcast, IEM-Aud
Total Time: 4 hours 12 minutes 47 seconds

Various dates at various locations
(infos taken from brucebase.wikispaces.com)

Linage:
jungleland downloads, flac trades, silver cds ->
converted to .wav with DB Poweramp ->
mixed with Magix Audio Cleaning Lab 16 -> .wav ->
Traders Little Helper -> Flac (Level 8, Align on SB, Verify)

Notes:
The idea for this compilation based on near the same setlist, which the Springsteen tribute band 'Tramps
Like Us' played last summer in the NJ/NY area. Tramps Like Us has consulted with a panel of Bruce experts to
create what they would consider to be the greatest Springsteen concert NEVER played!
The setlist was chosen by Mike Appel (Former Springsteen manager & producer), Stan Goldstein (Springsteen
blogger for NJ.com), Lawrence Kirsch (Author of 2 best selling Springsteen books Ã¢â‚¬Å“For YouÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Light
in DarknessÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½), Thomas Wilkinson (Former program director for SiriusXM's E Street Radio) and Mark Salore
(Front man of 'Tramps Like Us'). As I read the announcement on backstreets.com and saw the setlist for this
gig I was very impressed. I had hoped that someone would tape it, but unfortunately it won't. The idea for
this compilation was born. Of course, it's a lot of personal taste.

A big thank you goes out to Flynn who gave me many suggestions to select the best version of each track.
Further I want to thank you the JEMS crew, Hoserama, Ev2, Spider Web and Fanatic Records for their 
permission to use their work.

At least, enjoy this compilation!!!
